data.title: Great Stay at the Ash Street Inn
data.text: I am in love with this place.  So quaint...such history....It was immaculate...breakfast was delicious.  The owners are wonderful.  Robert has such a great sense of humor and Margit is so warm and friendly!  I highly recommend this Inn.  Awesome stay!

data.title: Wonderful B&B
data.text: Spent one night at this lovely inn. Greeted by owner Margit and shown our lovely room, which was outfitted with virtually any need we might have. Very comfy bed, linens and towels. In addition to the typical toiletries there was tooth paste and lip balm! Fresh homemade cookies and a complete snack bar with sweet and salty snacks as well as a variety of coffees, teas, sodas and fresh fruit.  Breakfast was cooked to order by Rob, the husband and co-owner, and trained ched. Delicious  cinnamon vanilla french toast with New Hampshire maple syrup. Yogurt with freshly made granola. Had a very pleasant morning chat with both Margit and Rob. Very hospitable and friendly. Wonderful stay. Highly recommend.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Audrey,

Thanks for the kind words, we are glad you enjoyed your stay and that the weather has been great for your New England Trip. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again if your travlels bring you this way.
Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Exemplary Inn
data.text: Ash Street Inn is conveniently located to many attractions.  It is immaculate,and every room is well appointed.  The breakfasts are delicious, and the hosts are delightful!  We cannot wait to return!  We have stayed in many New England Inns & this rates among the top.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Laura,

Thanks very much for the feedback, we are glad you enjoyed The Queen City and your stay with us. We look forward to your return as well.

Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: We loved staying at the Ash Street Inn!
data.text: Our party of 4 stayed at the Ash Street Inn overnight on our New England states tour.  We enjoyed our stay here so much!  Rob and Margit, the owners; were a personable couple and very accommodating.  They shared tips and advice regarding the area and getting to our next destination.  The house was wonderful.  We were on the second floor and the rooms were beautifully decorated, clean and had comfortable beds.  While this is an old home, it is very well maintained and updated just enough so that you don't sacrifice modern conveniences.  The bathroom was very nice and included many nice amenities.  Margit showed us where everything was, including drinks in the fridge, fresh baked cookies and muffins, fruit and snacks on the counter, all available for our consumption!  Little bowls of candy were placed throughout the house as well.  After a restful sleep, we sat on the porch enjoying fresh coffee.  Then we enjoyed a delicious breakfast prepared by Chef Rob!  My sister fell in love with the homemade granola. Overall, this was our favorite place for lodging throughout the whole trip!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks MsGME! 

We are so glad you enjoyed your trip and that you and family and friends had a wonderful time. (I'm also glad that your sister enjoyed the granola!)

We hope you had an uneventful trip back home and thanks again for choosing The Ash Street Inn

Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Charming Inn in Manchester
data.text: We stayed at this lovely Inn for one night before catching a flight early morning. So glad we booked here instead of an airport motel. The innkeepers were most accommodating providing us with a delicious "to go" breakfast sandwich to have before our flight. Our room had a super comfortable bed and pillows. Towels in the bath are extra plush and they provide nice robes. They also provide lots of little extras that a traveler may need. We arrived early and they were very gracious in letting us check in since our room was ready. Highly recommend if you're in the Manchester area!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are so glad that you enjoyed your (albeit) short stay with us and that the to-go breakfast sandwich hit the spot. We try to accommodate most dietary needs and I guess the early AM traveler is one on them!  (Being only a 15-20 minute drive to the airport makes us an airport option, especially for those who want to explore downtown the night before.) We hope that the next time your travels bring you this way you can spend a little more time to enjoy the Inn.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Family Reunion
data.text: We recently had a family reunion at the Ash Street Inn.  What a wonderful experience.  We used all five bedrooms.  We loved looking at the antique touches in each of our rooms.  It is an 1885 Victorian that has been modernized yet it has maintained its unique antique character.  The hosts couldn't have been more cordial or accommodating. With each room, we were given our bedroom key as well as a front door key.  There were no time limits for coming and going.  The kitchen was open for snacks and drinks anytime. The breakfast was delicious.  We had beautiful weather which allowed us to enjoy our time outside chatting on the porch.  Would love to go there every weekend.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are glad you and your family had a wonderful time, and thanks for the kind words. We enjoyed sharing our house with you and also enjoyed the pizza you shared with us! It seemed to be a special weekend for your family and the laughs and good time were nice to hear. We hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Enhancing our Daughter's Wedding Weekend
data.text: The wedding party for our daughter's reception at the Currier Museum of Art all stayed at the Ash St. Inn. Not only is it a beautiful spot for photos of the bride and her family getting ready, but Rob and Margit's hospitality helped everyone to relax and enjoy every minute leading up to and after the wedding. Each room is distinctively beautiful; all of the special touches made everyone feel pampered; the food and conversation were splendid. Even though we live fairly close to the inn, we would definitely go back for a special weekend. Our daughter and her husband are already planning to spend their anniversaries there each year.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the kind words. We are happy to have helped making the wedding day special! It was fun to see our Inn being transformed into a beauty parlor, a hair salon a photo studio and above all, a place for bride and groom and their parents and friends to share last pre-wedding moments together. You have been wonderful guests and we are looking forward to seeing you again!

Margit and Rob
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Perfect Experience
data.text: We had the opportunity to experience the Ash Street Inn for a wedding reception held at the nearby Currier Gallery of Art.  Having never experienced a bed and breakfast before, we were both pleasantly surprised.  This inn is well run by innkeepers who truly have a passion for providing guests with a comfortable environment and memorable experience.  Rob and Margit are the perfect hosts.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Again!
Thanks for the kind words, we are so glad that we made your first B&B experience memorable. It was wonderful to share the wedding day with the bride and her family. Margit and Rob
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A great gem in the heart of Manchester!
data.text: A very cute B&B right near downtown Manchester.   Great folks that run it,  beautiful rooms and house.   Lots of nice little elements to the place.  They put out fantastic little treats and the breakfast is fantastic.  We hope to go back again!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, 

We are glad you were able to enjoy your getaway weekend in Manchester and look forward to seeing you again. Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Pleasant
data.text: Our 2 night stay was very pleasant. Owners are anxious to provide the best service without being obtrusive. Breakfasts are made to order & offer good choice. Inn is very convenient to the Currier Museum with its selection of excellent art. Downtown is a convenient 5-10 minute drive. We will happliy return when in the Manchester area.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we are doing. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you back here on your next trip to Manchester.
Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely Experience!
data.text: Ash Street Inn is a real gem!  My boyfriend & I stayed here overnight during a weekend trip up to NH to see a concert. The Inn is so beautifully appointed with modern upgrades that do not compromise the original charm & character of this 1800's Victorian.  The stained glass windows are breathtakingly beautiful.  Both the house and grounds are immaculately maintained and the hosts have literally thought of every single thing.  So many little thoughtful details to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.  Rob and Margit are delightful hosts who made us feel right at home! The bed was sooo comfortable and the made to order breakfast was delicious.  Our only regret is that we did not stay longer.  We hope to make it back someday!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Leigh Anne,

We are glad you had a wonderful stay,  hope you enjoyed the Zimmerman House tour as well. We too hope you do get to visit again. Margit and Rob
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love it!
data.text:
What a beautiful B&B. So well decorated with high quality furniture, bedding,... loved staying there, and we'll go back in Winter to stay in one of the rooms with fire place. 
Wonderful lovely hosts. 
Thank you Margit and Rob. 
We've been to 4 and 5 star hotels as Bretton woods,..., your B&B is as nice for prople who need a different experience.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Naomi,

We are glad you enjoyed your (albeit short) stay. We look forward to you visiting again. Perhaps next time it can be a little longer so you may enjoy more of what the Queen City offers. 

Thanks again, Rob & Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I Think I am In Love!!!
data.text: I absolutely loved staying at Ash Street Inn for a long weekend getaway with my husband! We enjoyed every minute of this beautiful place! The owners Rob and Margit are amazing people who really cater to their guest's needs! I cannot wait until I can plan a trip back here for a longer stay!!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for staying with us and the kind words, glad you both enjoyed your brief stay in New Hampshire and also the 20 degree drop in temperature overnight!  Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Better than a 5 star Hotel!!!
data.text:
My husband and I, and my elderly mom stayed at this gem of an inn this past weekend (5/21/16). Being in architectural field we more than appreciated the beautiful interiors and decor.  From that alone  you get the sense that this is no ordinary inn. 
Our room was on the 2nd floor and featured beautiful furnishings, linens, a lovely settee,  and a turret alcove. The bathroom was modern, crisp, clean and larger than I expected.  Every detail was so thought out, from the make up remover towelets,  tons of fluffy towels, hand lotion, toothpaste, Tylenol, bottles of water, candy dishes everywhere for the midnight snack run. There is also a snack buffet in the dining room with home made cookies, fresh fruit, coffee and tea. There was nothing left to wish for!
There is outdoor seating on the porch for a nice cup of coffee.
Margit and Bob were such gracious hosts. They even went out of their way to accommodate us with a special request we had. We had a wonderful time and we will be sure to come back over and over again!
Also if you have an elderly person with you, be sure to ask for a room on the first floor.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for the kind words, we are glad that were able to make your daughter's graduation weekend a little more special and that you had a wonderful time.
Rob & Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This is the place!
data.text: If you are looking for a convenient, friendly, clean bed and breakfast then look no further. The Ash Street Inn is perfect. Our upstairs room was clean with a comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. I had a the special banana pecan French toast and I couldn't have been happier. This inn in located a short walk from some great restaurants and the art museum. My only complaint is, as a non-smoking facility, they should also discourage smoking on their wrap around porch. A couple times we were driven off by another guest's smoke. Again, if you want a comfortable, pleasant stay look no further than the Ash Street Inn.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the nice words Lou, we're glad you enjoyed your trip to Manchester and the Zimmerman House visit. We also appreciate the feedback on the porch. We are looking at other options for our guests who smoke and will keep that in mind. Rob & Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable, Casual Stay
data.text: The proprietors of the Ash Street Inn have cultivated a lovely guest home in what seems to be the only B&B in town.  The location is fairly residential but within walking distance of the Currier Museum of Art, Elm Street attractions, and even Livingston Park and Dorr's Pond if a mile doesn't daunt. The rooms are quiet, very clean, nicely appointed, and outfitted with sumptuous sheets and cozy bathrobes.  Satellite TV, free wi-fi, wireless, bluetooth keyboards and the ability to print make any business traveller at home.  The variety of coffees, teas, fruit and freshly-baked muffins available throughout the day is sure to fill any snacking traveller.  Homemade granola and breakfast cooked to order do not disappoint—blueberry pancakes are fluffy yet berry-packed and served with warmed, local syrup.  The hosts are happy to provide direction and answer any questions one might have.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We  hope that if your travels bring you back to the Queen City you choose to stay with us again. 

Thanks, Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delightful Stay, Fabulous B&B!
data.text: This lovely Queen Anne is not to be missed! I was traveling with a friend and we were flying out of Manchester the next morning after our stay. Everything was impeccable! Margit and Robert have thought of every little detail to make one's stay perfect! Room 206 worked out great for us, as we utilized the daybed for the second person. Parking was easy in the private lot, we were able to walk a few blocks to a local pizzeria for a casual dinner, and Robert accommodated our early departure with omelettes made to order! No complaints here at all - only praise! I would love to return with my husband some day. Thank you, Margit and Robert! You were superb hosts!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi, Thanks for the wonderful feedback. We are glad that we were able to make your last day in NH enjoyable. Being close to the airport certainly makes us a viable option for early flights out of MHT, and who doesn't enjoy a cooked to order omelette on a getaway day? We hope to see you again when your travels bring you back this way. Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful Inn with lovely, gracious hosts
data.text: The house is lovely and the rooms are wonderfully appointed.  Our room had such delightful details-- a turret nook with a writing desk and stained glass windows, a lovely antique armoire.  But best of all were the hosts-- Margit and Rob were so warm and welcoming.  Breakfasts were delicious, generous, and relaxing.  We stay in B&Bs fairly often, and this is one of the best we've stayed in.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the wonderful feedback and we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you both again next time your travels take you to Manchester. Rob and Margit
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: ***GREAT***
data.text: My friend and I stayed one night. We loved it! The house was beautiful, warm and welcoming. It snow, which was unexpected but the inn keepers told us about the museum and gave us free tickets. In the morning breakfast was fantastic!!

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the feedback and staying with us, while we may not have been the "hike in the Catskills" you originally planned. We are glad you were still able to enjoy a few days off.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: All the comfort of home, with local knowledge!
data.text:
The Ash Street Inn was our first stop on our New England road trip and boy did it set the bar high. We checked in after a long day of travel and Rob gave us a quick tour, advised us on local restaurants, and left us to get settled in. The room was amazing (it reminded me of the house I grew up in) and you had everything you needed. Snacks and drinks were always available on the kitchen and plenty of local literature was available in the foyer. Breakfast was cooked to order (customized from 3-4 options) and was amazing. Then Rod and Margit gave us advice on potential stops along our road trips. I've had the opportunity to stay at many hotels and inns but this was the single best night I've spent away from home!

As our first B&B experience, we had no idea what to expect but it was a great experience. The Ash Street Inn gives you enough privacy but the innkeepers are there to assist you in any way possible. It was really like staying with family while on vacation. We only wished we'd planned to stay longer and have already been discussing how we justify another trip to Ash Street Inn.

owner_response.author: Robert W, Owner at Ash Street Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks very much for your wonderful feedback. We are glad that we were able to provide a welcome springboard to your New England vacation and hope that the Spring Snow will be a pleasant memory when the HOTLANTA summer is in full swing. Thanks again for staying with us, Margit and Rob
owner_response.title: Owner Response
